title: Ex-Manchester United star Javier Hernandez ‘calls off engagement following secret Paris tryst with stunning Mexican singer’
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JAVIER HERNANDEZ has cancelled his engagement to Lucia Vilallon after a secret Paris tryst with a stunning Mexican actress, according to reports. 
The Latin Times claims that the couple have officially broken up after weeks of speculation. A photo posted by Camila Sodi (@camilasodi_) on Oct 3, 2016 at 7:20am PDT A photo posted by Camila Sodi (@camilasodi_) on Sep 8, 2016 at 1:00pm PDT 
Hernandez was apparently spotted kissing his lover Camila Sodi, the ex-wife of actor Diego Luna, who he took out for ice cream. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals 
He has removed all photos of former flame Vilallon from his Instagram. 
While both have taken the number ‘1422’– which symbolised their relationship – from their social media bios. 
Chicharito wears the number 14 shirt, while Villalon’s lucky number is 22. Hernandez could be on his way to Los Angeles FC – and a very big pay packet. 
ESPN Deportes show Jorge Ramos y tu Banda have tweeted that the new MLS franchise are about to offer £12m-a-year to the Mexican. 
Chicarito has failed to net in three months for Leverkusen after a brilliant start and German tabloid Bild reported in January that an offer of £21.5m will force the Bundesliga club’s hand. A photo posted by Camila Sodi (@camilasodi_) on May 14, 2016 at 8:06am PDT A photo posted by Camila Sodi (@camilasodi_) on Aug 14, 2016 at 2:10pm PDT CEN Javier Hernandez has cancelled his wedding to Lucia Villalon CEN The pair got engaged last year CEN Villalon is a Spanish journalist CEN Hernandez met Villalon when he was playing for Real Madrid CEN Hernandez posted a cryptic message on Twitter CEN 6 Villalon also posted a picture on social media 
Hernandez himself is keen to stay with Leverkusen and previously said in an interview: “Why would I like to stay in the Bundesliga? Because I feel good and I’m happy. 
“I’ve learned a lot in the Bundesliga, as a player and as a man.”
